WorkItem.Description:
I keep getting the following error. I am running windows vista and have uninstalled .NET framework and reinstalled several times
 
Configuration system failed to initialize
 
at system.configuration.configurationmanager.prepareconfigsystem()
at system.configuration.configurationmanager.refrestsection(stringsectionname)
at system.configuration.clientsettingsstore.readsettings(stringsectionname, boolean isuserscoped)
at system.configuration.localfilesettingsprovider.getpropertyvalues(settingscontext, settingspropertycollection properties)
at system.configuration.settingsbase.getpropertiesfromprovider(Settings provider provider)
at system.configuration.settingsbase.getpropertyvaluebyname(string propertyname)
at system.configuration.settingsbase.get_item(string propertyname)
at system.configuration.applicationsettingsbase.getpropertyvalue(string propertyname)
at system.configuration.applicationsettingsbase.get_item(string propertyname)
at Rawr.properties.recent.get_recentmodel()
at Rawr.formmain..ctor()
at Rawr.program.main()

Comments.Message: I see you fixed my spelling but no other feedback?

...did you retype all that? You know there's a cool feature called copy and paste, right?

Anyway, that typically means something to do with bad file permissions. Try moving Rawr somewhere you have full permissions to (desktop, my docs, etc. NOT Program Files), and/or using Run as Administrator.

yes i typed it all out for some reason the error would not let me copy and paste and i have also tryed both loading from desktop, my documents and running as and administrator, no luck, i have also tryed running it in compatibility for windows xp
What exact path are you running Rawr from? ie: where are all the Rawr files located?

have tryed both
C:\Users\Jason\Downloads\Rawr v2.2.23
and 
C:\Users\Jason\Desktop\Rawr v2.2.23

What version of .Net have you installed? 

Are you running Vista 32 or Vista 64 bit? What Vista Service Pack are you on?

How many updates are available at windows update? Are any of them critical updates?

Are any of the files in Rawr directory marked as Read-Only?

I am running on .Net verison 3.5 sp1

Vista 32 bit service pack 2

all updates are up to date with the exception of language packs

there were Rawr files marked as read only just corrected that and still getting same issue
Are you running any Anti-Virus software?
yes i am running AVG antivirus
im still trying to find a solution to this issue if anyone will help
Try deleting your config files... Goto C:\Users\Jason\AppData\Local, and delete anything with Rawr in the name.
there was nothing located in appdata\local that is associated with Rawr
And Run as Administrator didn't do anything? That's what normally solves that issue. Can try disabling your virus protection that you mentioned as well.
